intro: Cheiridopsis albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, white flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It produces copious amounts of small, white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
